text:
AI is making you dumber. Because you use it wrong.

7 (stupid) mistakes you must avoid:

☑ 1: Treating the prompt like a Google search bar

One-line, zero-context queries give you one-line, zero-context answers. If you won’t brief a human like that, don’t do it to a model.

☑ 2: Dumping a mess and hoping for magic

Uploading an un-edited doc-pile (“fix this”) is like tossing your laundry at a tailor. Give structure first: outline, goal, constraints. Then let the model stitch.

☑ 3: Accepting the first draft as gospel

The first reply is raw material. Mine it: ask follow-ups, request counterarguments, demand rewrites. Iterate or stay mediocre.

☑ 4: Hiding the audience from the AI

“Write an email” to whom? A CFO, a gamer, your grandma? Models mirror the reader you specify; skip this and you get generic slop.

☑ 5: Expecting clairvoyance without data

“Predict next quarter revenue” while withholding numbers is futile. Feed real inputs or enjoy fiction.

☑ 6: Blind-copy pasting hallucinations

If you don’t verify facts, citations, and links, the mistake isn’t the AI’s hallucination, it’s yours.

☑ 7: Outsourcing judgment you wouldn’t delegate to an intern

Strategy, ethics, hiring decisions—these need your neurons. Use the model for perspective, not responsibility.

Avoid these 7 sins and you will soon benefit from the fastest growing human invention ever made.
